meanings.definition: A strong belief that something will happen or be the case in the future.
meanings.sent1: Her expectation of winning the game was high.
meanings.sent2: The audience had an expectation of a great performance.
meanings.sent3: His expectation of finding a unicorn in the backyard was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The expectation hung over her head like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The expectation of a surprise made the party exciting.

meanings.definition: The state of expecting or looking forward to something.
meanings.sent1: The children were filled with expectation on Christmas Eve.
meanings.sent2: The expectation of a vacation kept her motivated at work.
meanings.sent3: The expectation of a snow day made the students giddy with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The expectation danced in her mind like a joyful melody.
meanings.sent5: The expectation of a new beginning brought hope to her heart.

meanings.definition: The act or state of expecting.
meanings.sent1: His expectation of a promotion led him to work harder.
meanings.sent2: The team's expectation of victory fueled their determination.
meanings.sent3: The expectation of a talking dog made the movie hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The expectation bloomed in her heart like a beautiful flower.
meanings.sent5: The expectation of a surprise party made her smile all day.
